properties.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 10:33PM EST until January 13 at 5:02AM EST by NWS Indianapolis IN
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a Flood
Warning for portions of the following waterways in central and
southern Indiana...

Sugar Creek...Wildcat Creek...


.Sugar Creek at New Palestine has reached bankfull conditions and
will be going into flood by 12 AM Sunday.  The creek is expected to
crest overnight about three tenths of a foot above flood stage then
fall below flood stage by late afternoon.

Wildcat Creek near Jerome has risen above flood stage and is
expected to crest by sunrise Sunday at about eight tenths of a foot
above flood stage.  The creek should pass below flood stage by late
evening.

The National Weather Service in Indianapolis has issued a

* Flood Warning for
the Wildcat Creek near Jerome.
* until late Sunday night.
* At 9:15 PM Saturday the stage was 9.1 feet.
* Flood stage is 9.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is occurring and Minor flooding is forecast.
* Forecast...It will rise to near 9.9 feet by Sunday morning then
begin falling. It will fall below flood stage Sunday evening.
* At 9.0 feet...Flooding in progress along Wildcat Creek in eastern
Howard County.  Water possibly two feet deep on CR 174 S just west
of Jerome Bridge on CR 1030 E.  Canoe area at SR 213 and nearby
park flooded.
